autonomics 0.99.0

    • autonomics

Contrast

add_limma.Rd

Fit linear model and analyze contrasts

add_limma(
  object,
  contrastdefs = contrast_subgroups(object),
  formula = if (single_subgroup(object)) ~1 else ~0 + subgroup,
  plot = TRUE,
  ...
)

Arguments

object

SummarizedExperiment
contrastdefs

contrastdef vector/matrix/list
formula

formula to create design matrix (using svars)
plot

TRUE/FALSE
...

passed to plot_contrastogram

Value

Updated SummarizedExperiment

Details

Limma results can be easily accessed with limma(object). This returns a list with components:

  • effect matrix (ngene x ncontrast): effect sizes

  • rank matrix (ngene x ncontrast): effect ranks

  • t matrix (ngene x ncontrast): t values (moderated t test)

  • se matrix (ngene x ncontrast): se values (moderated t test)

  • p matrix (ngene x ncontrast): p values (moderated t test)

  • fdr matrix (ngene x ncontrast): fdr values (moderated t test)

  • bonf matrix (ngene x ncontrast): bonf values (moderated t test)

  • F vector (ngene) : F values (moderated F test)

  • F.p vector (ngene) : p values (moderated F test)

Examples

require(magrittr)

#> Lade nötiges Paket: magrittr
file <- download_data('atkin18.somascan.adat')
object <- read_somascan(file, plot=FALSE)

#> 	Read: ~/autonomicscache/datasets/atkin18/atkin18.somascan.adat
#> 		Infer design from sample_ids
#> 		Guess replicate values from sampleids: t0.C15 => C15
#> 		========================================================
#> 		Sample types
#> 		Sample 
#> 		    67 
#> 		Retain 67/67 samples: ~SampleType %in% ~sample_type
#> 		========================================================
#> 		Sample qualities ("RowCheck")
#> 		PASS 
#> 		  67 
#> 		Retain 67/67 samples: ~RowCheck %in% ~sample_quality
#> 		========================================================
#> 		Feature qualities ("ColCheck")
#> 		FAIL PASS 
#> 		   4 1125 
#> 		Retain 1125/1129 features: ~ColCheck %in% ~feature_quality
#> 		========================================================
#> 		Log2 transform
#> 	Add PCA
#> 		Retain 1125/1125 features: non-zero, non-NA, and non-NaN for some sample
#> 		Run limma
add_limma(object)

#> 		Run limma
#> class: SummarizedExperiment 
#> dim: 1125 67 
#> metadata(7): analysis file ... contrastdefs limma
#> assays(1): exprs
#> rownames(1125): 2182-54_1 2190-55_1 ... 5491-12_3 5494-52_3
#> rowData names(19): feature_id feature_name ... F F.p
#> colnames(67): t0.C15 t0.D14 ... t3.C01 t3.C10
#> colData names(27): sample_id subgroup ... pca1 pca2

file <- download_data('billing19.proteingroups.txt')
select_subgroups <-  c(sprintf(
    '%s_STD', c('EM00','EM01', 'EM02','EM05','EM15','EM30', 'BM00')))
object <- read_proteingroups(
            file, select_subgroups = select_subgroups, plot = FALSE)

#> 	Read: ~/autonomicscache/datasets/billing19/billing19.proteingroups.txt
#> 		Rm 70 features with missing 'feature_id' values
#> 	Prepare samples
#> 	Prepare samples
#> 		Standardize snames: Ratio M/L normalized STD(L).EM00(M).EM01(H).R1  ->  STD(L).EM00(M).EM01(H).R1{M/L}
#> 		Demultiplex snames: STD(L).EM00(M).EM01(H).R1{M/L}  ->  EM00_STD.R1
#> 		Uniquify snames: BM00_STD.R10 -> BM00_STD.R10ML (for 2/33 snames)
#> 		Read design (update if required!): ~/autonomicscache/datasets/billing19/billing19.proteingroups.Ratio.normalized.design.txt
#> 		Retain 21/33 samples: ~subgroup %in% select_subgroups
#> 	Log2 transform
#> 		Replace NaN -> NA for 77204/205338 values (in 5423/9778 features and 21/21 samples)
#> 		Log2 transform
#> 	Filter features
#> 		Retain 9566/9778 features: ~Reverse != "+"
#> 		Retain 9470/9566 features: contaminant != '+'
#> 		Retain 7864/9470 features: non-zero, non-NA, and non-NaN for some sample
#> 		Filter 7094/7864 features: expr != 0 for at least two samples in some subgroup
#> 	Transform exprs
#> 	Add PCA
#> 		Retain 7094/7094 features: non-zero, non-NA, and non-NaN for some sample
#> 		Run limma
object$subgroup %<>% gsub('_STD', '', .)
object$subgroup %<>% factor(sort(unique(.))[c(2:length(.), 1)])
object %<>% add_limma()

#> 		Run limma

file <- download_data('billing19.rnacounts.txt')
object <- read_counts(file, plot=FALSE)

#> 	Read: ~/autonomicscache/datasets/billing19/billing19.rnacounts.txt
#> 		Read design (update if required!): ~/autonomicscache/datasets/billing19/billing19.rnacounts.design.txt
#> 		Keep 21990/56268 features: count >= 10 in at least some samples
#> 		TMM normalize and log2transform
#> 		Return object: counts(object)  = counts
#> 		               exprs(object)   = log2cpm
#> 		               weights(object) = voom weights (see plot)
#> 		               object$subgroup = subgroup values
#> 	Add PCA
#> 		Retain 21990/21990 features: non-zero, non-NA, and non-NaN for some sample
#> 		Run limma
object$subgroup %<>% factor(sort(unique(.))[c(2:length(.), 1)])
object %<>% add_limma()

#> 		Run limma

file <- download_data('halama18.metabolon.xlsx')
object <- read_metabolon(file, plot = FALSE)

#> 	Read: ~/autonomicscache/datasets/halama18/halama18.metabolon.xlsx
#> 		Infer design from sample_ids
#> 		Guess replicate values from sampleids: ctrl_h10_R1 => R1
#> 		Log2 transform
#> 	Add PCA
#> 		Retain 391/391 features: non-zero, non-NA, and non-NaN for some sample
#> 		Run limma
object %<>% add_limma()

#> 		Run limma
